*COMMITMENTS*


</s> <s=13> *2.1 Our Identity*


</s> <s=11> SAFEXPRESS LOGISTICS INC. is a dynamic logistics company providing end-to-end supply
chain solutions, specializing in efficient warehousing, distribution, freight management,
transportation, and value-added services nationwide.


</s> <s=13> *2.2 Core Purpose*


</s> <s=11> *To be the driving force that optimizes, enhances, and empowers our clients' supply chains.*
*We are not just moving goods; we are moving growth and success all over the country.*
</s>

</s> <s=11> At SAFEXPRESS LOGISTICS INC., we are committed to delivering reliable, compliant logistics

<s=13> *_ 4.0 Disaster Scenario: Major Power and Network Outage _*


</s> <s=11> *_ 4.1 Response and Activation _*


_1._ *_ Immediate Action: IC to declare Level 2 (Major Disruption). _*
_2._ *_ Communication: Activate satellite/backup communication devices. Notify all critical _*
_personnel via SMS/alternative channel._
_3._ *_ WMS/IT: IT Lead immediately switches to off-site cloud servers (if applicable) or initiates _*
*_ Backup & Recovery Procedure (Refer to IT Manual). _*


*_ 4.2 Logistics Continuity Protocol _*


_●_ *_ Dispatch: Switch to manual dispatch procedures using pre-printed Delivery Order (DO) _*
*_ and Bill of Lading (BOL) forms. Log all movements via secure chat groups. _*
_●_ *_ Warehouse: Halt all non-critical picking/packing. Receiving must be done manually, _*
*_ creating handwritten Receiving Reports. No movement of High-Value Cargo without _*
_dual sign-off._
_●_ *_ Data: Once systems are restored,

The primary objective of this BCDR Plan is to minimize the impact of unforeseen events (natural disasters, system failures, power outages, etc.) on our core logistics services (Safety, Quality, Delivery). We commit to the protection of personnel, client cargo, and vital business data, ensuring an acceptable level of service continuity.
results.context: Objectives of the BCDR Plan to ensure service continuity

*_ Excerpt _*


</s> <s=11> _This document is designed to ensure that SAFEXPRESS LOGISTICS INC. can maintain critical_
_operations and quickly resume standard functions following a significant disruption or disaster._


</s> <s=13> *_ BCDR Plan: SAFEXPRESS LOGISTICS INC. _*

[TABLE]
Section | Title
Document No. | BCDR-001
Date Issued | November 2025
Revision | 1.0
Applicability | All Head Office and Branch Operations
[/TABLE]

*_ 1.0 Introduction and Policy _*


</s> <s=11> _The primary objective of this BCDR Plan is to minimize the impact of unforeseen events (natural_
*_ disasters, system failures, power outages, etc.) on our core logistics services (Safety, Quality, _*
*_ Delivery). We commit to the protection of personnel, client cargo, and vital business data, _*
_ensuring an acceptable level of service continuity._

[TABLE]
Section | Title
Document No. | BCDR-001
Date Issued | November 2025
Revision | 1.0
Applicability | All Head Office and Branch Operations

*_ 1.0 Introduction and Policy _*


</s> <s=11> _The primary objective of this BCDR Plan is to minimize the impact of unforeseen events (natural_
*_ disasters, system failures, power outages, etc.) on our core logistics services (Safety, Quality, _*
*_ Delivery). We commit to the protection of personnel, client cargo, and vital business data, _*
_ensuring an acceptable level of service continuity._


</s> <s=13> *_ 2.0 Critical Business Functions (CBFs) and Recovery Objectives _*


</s

● Dispatch: Switch to manual dispatch procedures using pre-printed Delivery Order (DO) and Bill of Lading (BOL) forms. Log all movements via secure chat groups.
● Warehouse: Halt all non-critical picking/packing. Receiving must be done manually, creating handwritten Receiving Reports. No movement of High-Value Cargo without dual sign-off.
● Data: Once systems are restored, all manual records must be prioritized for data entry to meet RPO of 12 hours for WMS data.
results.context: Steps for logistics continuity during power and network outages

[PAGE=1]
<s=17> *_ Standard _* *_ Operating _* *_ Procedure _* *_ (SOP) _* *_ for _* *_ Goods _*


*_ Receiving _*


</s> <s=11> _This procedure ensures that all incoming goods are handled efficiently, accurately, and safely,_
_adhering_ _to_ _the_ _Quality_ _Policy_ _and_ _preventing_ _stock_ _reconciliation_ _errors._


</s> <s=13> *_ 1.0 Purpose _*


</s> <s=11> _To establish a uniform and controlled process for the receipt, inspection, and recording of all_
_incoming cargo and materials, ensuring compliance with client instructions and minimizing_
_discrepancies._


</s> <s=13> *_ 2.0 Procedure Steps _*

[TABLE]
Step | Action | Responsibility | Quality/Safety Check
2.1 | Vehicle/Cargo
Check-in | Gate Guard /
Receiving Clerk | Verify the transporter's details against the
expected Delivery Order (DO) or Advanced
Shipping Notice (ASN). Check the vehicle
for signs of tampering or damage before
docking.
2.2 | Unloading
Preparation | Receiving
Supervisor | Clear the staging area. Ensure

must perform a Daily Vehicle Inspection Report (DVIR) before operating any*


company vehicle. Any defects must be reported and corrected before departure.


● *No use of mobile phones or electronic devices while the vehicle is in motion.*


</s> <s=13> *3.2 Fatigue Management*


</s> <s=11> ● Drivers must adhere strictly to mandated driving hours and rest periods to prevent


fatigue-related accidents.


● Drivers must report any physical signs of excessive fatigue immediately and pull over


safely.


</s> <s=17> *SECTION 4: EMERGENCY RESPONSE & REPORTING*


</s> <s=13> *4.1 Accident and Incident Reporting (Refer to Incident/Accident Report*


*Forms)*
</s>

[PAGE=4]
<s=11> ● *_ All injuries, illnesses, accidents, property damage, and near-misses (events that could _*


have caused harm) must be reported immediately to the supervisor and HSE Officer.


● *An investigation must be conducted for every incident to determine the root cause and*


implement preventative measures.


</s>

</s> <s=11> As an ISO 9001:2015 QMS Certified company, quality is non-negotiable.


● *Documentation and Accuracy: Utilize the Warehouse Management Systems (WMS)*
*correctly to ensure real-time inventory tracking and accurate reporting. Errors in*
documentation directly impact our Quality KPI.
● *Continuous Improvement: Employees are encouraged to suggest improvements to*
processes that enhance efficiency, safety, and compliance.
</s>

[PAGE=4]
<s=13> *3.4 Operational Standards*


</s> <s=11> ● *Warehousing: Employees involved in storage must ensure goods are handled with*
precision and care, maintaining the specified environmental conditions (Cold,
Temp-Controlled, Dry) and optimizing inventory control and order fulfillment.
● *Transportation: Vehicle operators are responsible for the safe operation and routine*
inspection of their assigned vehicles. They must use real-time tracking platforms to
ensure visibility and timely updates for clients.

<s=13> *_ 3.0 Control Checklists (Receiving/Dispatch Checklist) _*


</s> <s=11> _●_ _[ ] ASN/DO verified against physical shipment._
_●_ _[ ] Total Piece Count verified (Tally vs. BOL)._
_●_ _[ ] Cargo inspected for damage (Pass/Fail)._
_●_ _[ ] WMS entry completed and System Receiving Report generated._
_●_ _[ ] Discrepancy logged and resolution confirmed (if applicable)._
_●_ _[ ] Final put-away scan confirmed in WMS._
</s>

with clients and partners must be professional, cooperative, and focused on solving their
needs.
● *Confidentiality: All company information, client data, inventory details, pricing*
structures, and operational strategies are strictly confidential and must not be disclosed
to unauthorized parties.


</s> <s=13> *3.2 Health, Safety, and Environment (HSE)*


</s> <s=11> Due to the nature of logistics, strict adherence to HSE protocols is mandatory.


● *Zero-Accident Policy: All personnel are required to follow safety procedures, wear*
appropriate Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) in designated areas (e.g.,
warehouses, yards), and report all hazards, near-misses, and incidents immediately.
● *Compliance: All transport operations must strictly adhere to local and national traffic*
laws and regulations. All warehouse operations must comply with industry safety
standards, particularly for Cold, Temperature-Controlled, and Ambient storage.


</s> <s=13> *3.3 Quality Management and Complia

</s> <s=13> *3.2 Health, Safety, and Environment (HSE)*


</s> <s=11> Due to the nature of logistics, strict adherence to HSE protocols is mandatory.


● *Zero-Accident Policy: All personnel are required to follow safety procedures, wear*
appropriate Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) in designated areas (e.g.,
warehouses, yards), and report all hazards, near-misses, and incidents immediately.
● *Compliance: All transport operations must strictly adhere to local and national traffic*
laws and regulations. All warehouse operations must comply with industry safety
standards, particularly for Cold, Temperature-Controlled, and Ambient storage.


</s> <s=13> *3.3 Quality Management and Complia

4.3 Training and Development 
SAFEXPRESS LOGISTICS INC. values continuous learning. The company provides ongoing 
training to maintain a skilled team and sustain the best service for our customers. Employees 
are expected to actively participate in all mandatory training sessions related to safety, quality, 
and new technology (e.g., WMS updates).

*ADMINISTRATION*


</s> <s=13> *4.1 Work Hours and Attendance*


</s> <s=11> All employees are expected to adhere to their scheduled work hours and locations (Head Office,
Warehouse, Field, etc.). Punctuality and reliable attendance are essential to maintaining the
efficiency of our 24/7 logistics operations. Absences and tardiness must be reported according
to department-specific procedures.


</s> <s=13> *4.2 Leave and Benefits*


</s> <s=11> Details regarding employee compensation, paid time off, health benefits, and mandatory
government contributions are managed by the HR Department. Consult with HR for specific
entitlements.

</s> <s=11> *Incident Reporting: All injuries, illnesses, accidents, property damage, and near-* •
</s> <s=12> misses must be reported immediately to the supervisor and HSE Officer.


</s> <s=11> *Evacuation: In the event of a ﬁre, sound the alarm and evacuate immediately. Do* •

3.4 Operational Standards 
●  Warehousing: Employees involved in storage must ensure goods are handled with 
precision and care, maintaining the specified environmental conditions (Cold, 
Temp-Controlled, Dry) and optimizing inventory control and order fulfillment. 
●  Transportation: Vehicle operators are responsible for the safe operation and routine 
inspection of their assigned vehicles. They must use real-time tracking platforms to 
ensure visibility and timely updates for clients. 
●  Distribution: Personnel must optimize routes and adhere to distribution schedules to
